message.content:
A lemon is a citrus fruit that grows on evergreen trees.
It is oval-shaped and typically yellow in color when ripe.
The skin of a lemon is smooth and glossy, with a slight texture to the touch.
Lemons have a sour and acidic taste due to their high citric acid content.
The fruit is a common ingredient in cooking, used to add flavor and acidity to dishes.
Lemons are also commonly used to make drinks such as lemonade and cocktails.
Lemon trees are typically grown in warm climates and can be found in grocery stores worldwide.
